item.title: Trading Strategy team is attending #Consensus #HongKong this week. Come and take a look at demos on how #quants have build, tested, optimised and launched amazing automated strategies for #DeFi markets. Very cool #memecoin strategies and #AI driven strategies, for example.
item.dc:creator: @TradingProtocol
item.description: Trading Strategy team is attending #Consensus #HongKong this week. Come and take a look at demos on how #quants have build, tested, optimised and launched amazing automated strategies for #DeFi markets. Very cool #memecoin strategies and #AI driven strategies, for example.

item.title:
RT by @TradingProtocol: At Trading Strategy, we do have backtesting data and backtesting framework for onchain automated trading.
https://tradingstrategy.ai/trading-view/backtesting
For some example insights, please see e.g. this blog post
https://tradingstrategy.ai/blog/trading-memecoins
Our thesis with Trading Strategy is that you do not need robo-advisory (web 1.0 model), but directly investable strategies onchain. So the vision "AI and DeFi is the future" is correct, but the thesis what kind of implementation will work is lost in today's narrative.
A lot of "agent trading" is indeed broken narrative. Why would you trade signals when you have all of these automation to actually trade for you? Let machines to machines work, and long term machines outperform humans in trading if let run by itself.
This was also touched by Keone from Monad, a former machine learn quant, in this post of his where we reviewed one of the agents as nonsense:
https://x.com/keoneHD/status/1870739092247351667
item.dc:creator: @moo9000
item.description:
At Trading Strategy, we do have backtesting data and backtesting framework for onchain automated trading.

tradingstrategy.ai/trading-v…

For some example insights, please see e.g. this blog post

tradingstrategy.ai/blog/trad…

Our thesis with Trading Strategy is that you do not need robo-advisory (web 1.0 model), but directly investable strategies onchain. So the vision "AI and DeFi is the future" is correct, but the thesis what kind of implementation will work is lost in today's narrative.

A lot of "agent trading" is indeed broken narrative. Why would you trade signals when you have all of these automation to actually trade for you? Let machines to machines work, and long term machines outperform humans in trading if let run by itself.

This was also touched by Keone from Monad, a former machine learn quant, in this post of his where we reviewed one of the agents as nonsense:
